The recent activity feed is an auto-updating list of actions that have recently occurred on your social network. This information is displayed (by default) on users' My Home" page. Also, each user's own personal activity list will be displayed on their profile page if enabled below. Please note that some of the settings here are not retroactive, meaning that changes you make here may not affect old feed items."
Allowed Feed Items
Which feed items do you want to be shown in the recent activity feed?
Overall Feed Length
How many total items do you want the main activity feed to display at any given time?
Item Limit Per User

How many items per user can be shown on the recent activity feed? It's important to have a nice mix of items from various users on your social network, so here you can set a limit on the number of items published about each user at any given time. For smaller social networks, a highernumber of published items per user might be more appropriate.
Update Frequency

The application connects to your server (using AJAX) every few seconds to check if there are any new updates to the activity feed. How often do you want this process to occur? A shorter amount of time will consume more server resources. If your server is experiencing slowdown issues, try lowering the frequency the application checks for updates.

The application connects to your server (using AJAX) every few seconds to check if there are any new notifications. How often do you want this process to occur? A shorter amount of time will consume less server resources. If your server is experiencing slowdown issues, try lowering the frequency the application checks for updates.

Item Deletion
Do you want to give members the option of deleting feed items published about themselves? This is generally an important freedom to give members since it helps them maintain their privacy.

column1: Yes, allow members to delete their feed items.
column2: Yes, allow members to delete their feed items.

column1: No, members may not delete their feed items.
column2: No, members may not delete their feed items.
Feed Content

When a member is looking at the recent activity feed, whose actions should they see? For smaller networks, it may make more sense to show recent actions from "All Members" so the feed is quickly populated.
All Members
My Friends & Networks
My Friends
Feed Item Filtering

Do you want to allow members to decide which feed items they want to see in the main activity feed? If you enable this feature, members will be able specify which items types they do and do not want to see in their recent activity feed.

column1: Yes, members can choose not to see certain feed item types.
column2: Yes, members can choose not to see certain feed item types.

column1: No, members cannot customize their view of the feed.
column2: No, members cannot customize their view of the feed.
Item Publishing Option

Do you want to allow members to prevent specific action types from being published about them? If yes, a setting will appear on your members' account settings page allowing them to choose which action types to NOT publish in the activity feed.

column1: Yes, members may specify which item types will NOT be published about them.
column2: Yes, members may specify which item types will NOT be published about them.

column1: No, members may not specify which actions will NOT be published about them.
column2: No, members may not specify which actions will NOT be published about them.

Comment
This email is sent to someone when a comment is made on their post.
[sender_title] commented on something you posted

[header]

A new comment has been posted on one of your posts by [sender_title]. Please click the following link to view it:

http://[host][object_link]

[footer]
Also Commented
This email is sent to the member when someone comments on a post the member has commented on.
[sender_title] also commented on a post you commented on

[header]

[sender_title] has also commented on a post you commented on. Please click the following link to view it:

http://[host][object_link]

[footer]
Like
This email is sent to the member when someone likes the member's post.
[sender_title] liked your post

[header]

[sender_title] has liked one of your posts. Please click the following link to view it:

http://[host][object_link]

[footer]
Comment on Liked
This email is sent to the member when someone comments on a post the member liked.

[header]
